stories.title: A 6-foot man earning $62K per year is as desirable as a 5'6“ man who earns $237K

stories.text:
~~ Satellite Engineering ~~

SpaceX has built the largest satellite constellation, Starlink, in the world with a goal to provide high speed internet to the over 3 billion people on the planet who don't have access to internet. We have been proud to be the main internet provider for the people of Ukraine right now, as well as bringing swift support to countries dealing with natural disasters like Tonga and Australia.

Location: Redmond, WA; Hawthorne, CA Software Engineer (Satellites): https://grnh.se/ce9a58eb2us

Location: Mountain View, CA Software Engineer (Starlink Wireless Control Plane): https://grnh.se/bc4200ea2us

Location: Mountain View, CA; Redmond, WA Sr. Software Engineer (Starlink IP & Routing): https://grnh.se/f063892f2us

Location: Redmond, WA Site Reliability Engineer: https://grnh.se/391163be2us

Location: Redmond, WA Date Engineer (Starlink Customer Experience): https://grnh.se/b2a713ee2us

SpaceX | On-site LA, Bay Area, Seattle, Austin, Washington DC, Starbase | Full Time | Software & Security Engineering

~~Vehicle Engineering~~

SpaceX engineers support the development of reusable rockets, spaceships & satellites!

Location: All locations Security Engineer, Components: https://grnh.se/4eecccfe2us

Location: Hawthorne, CA Software Engineer, Components: https://grnh.se/d5fd54f62us

On the paragenetic modes of minerals: A mineral evolution perspective

stories.text:
I wonder if reading a book or listening to audio book without comprehending it at the time of reading/listening is still valuable?

Case 1. Imagine you are reading (your eyes going through text) and brain got distracted while trying to comprehend and compare what you are reading with your experience from the past. You realize it after 1 page is done. Do you think your brain still can store chunks of data?

Case 2. You are reading super insightful book, which has 10 primary insights per page, but you only understand 1 insight. Do you think your brain still saved other insights and eventually will reveal it to you?

Case 3. You are listening audiobook and your brain didn't keep up with the content (language understanding or trying to comprehend past sentences made you think about it too much, and anything else) Because going back and forth can slow down the listening, do you think continuing listening is still valuable and gives enough insights?

Why am I asking? I have mild ADHD and reading books is difficult to me, add into this language understanding (English is not my native language) and I am spending 10-15 minutes per page, trying to understand everything.

At the same time, OReilly subscription makes me really sad, by telling book with ~200 pages takes 5h to finish.
stories.title: Ask HN: Value of reading a book without comprehension?
